intro: Meliosma laxiflora, commonly known as the broad-leaved meliosma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
